docs.snippet: AUSTIN, Tex., June 17 (AP) -- The White House office announced today President Johnson's choices for Ambassador to Poland, Uruguay and Mali.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex., June 17 (AP) -- The White House office announced today President Johnson's choices for Ambassador to Poland, Uruguay and Mali.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 18 (Reuters) -- Uruguayan workers today openly defied Government security measures and brought this tiny South American country to a virtual standstill.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 18 (Reuters) -- Uruguayan workers today openly defied Government security measures and brought this tiny South American country to a virtual standstill.
docs.abstract: Thousands of workers heed Natl Workers' Conv call for gen strike, bringing nation to virtual standstill; docks, rrs, Govt and municipal offices and natl Post Office close; strikers demand higer wages to keep pace with cost of living increase of 130% in last yr and protest security measures imposed by Pres Pacheco Areco banning union meetings and pub gatherings

headline.main: Uruguay Crippled By General Strike Defying the Regime

docs.snippet: Cirillo (Pepe) Fernandez will lead the San Diego Toros, the pace-setters in the Pacific Division of the North American Soccer League, against the battered New York Generals tonight at the Yankee Stadium. It's likely to be the final game of the season...
docs.lead_paragraph: Cirillo (Pepe) Fernandez will lead the San Diego Toros, the pace-setters in the Pacific Division of the North American Soccer League, against the battered New York Generals tonight at the Yankee Stadium. It's likely to be the final game of the season for the 24-year-old Uruguay booter, who has scored 18 goals in 16 games to pace the league.

headline.main: TOROS, GENERALS TO MEET TONIGHT; Game Likely to Be Last of Season for Fernandez

headline.main: Uruguay, to Stem Inflation, Freezes Prices and Wages

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 29 -Latin America, isolated by geography and tradition from most of the great upheavals of the rest of the world, has succumbed to what one exasperated official terms the "international student plague."
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 29 -Latin America, isolated by geography and tradition from most of the great upheavals of the rest of the world, has succumbed to what one exasperated official terms the "international student plague."
docs.abstract: article on student unrest sweeping continent; NY Times correspondents rept student demonstrators face dilemma of whether to protest against soc evils and risk loss of soc and financial rewards which come from higher educ; see students aiming chiefly at greater participation in univ adm

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 4 -- Two truckloads of soldiers and a troop of mounted policemen swiftly surrounded a Government bank building in the center of town one day recently and hauled out several dozen employes.
